dataitem.name: Message Type
dataitem.definition: This Data Item allows for a more convenient handling of the messages at the receiver side by further defining the type of transaction.

field.name: Message Type
field.enum: RIMCAS Arrival / Departure Wrong Runway Alert (WRA)
RIMCAS Arrival / Departure Opposite Traffic Alert (OTA)

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. In applications where transactions of various types are exchanged, the Message Type Data Item facilitates the proper message handling at the receiver side.
2. All Message Type values are reserved for common standard use.
3.The following set of Message Types are standardised for Category 004 records:
• 001 Alive Message
• 002 Route Adherence Monitor Longitudinal Deviation
• 003 Route Adherence Monitor Heading Deviation
• 004 Minimum Safe Altitude Warning
• 005 Area Proximity Warning
• 006 Clearance Level Adherence Monitor
• 007 Short Term Conflict Alert
• 008 Approach Funnel Deviation Alert
• 009 RIMCAS Arrival / Landing Monitor (ALM)
• 010 RIMCAS Arrival / Departure Wrong Runway Alert (WRA)
• 011 RIMCAS Arrival / Departure Opposite Traffic Alert (OTA)
• 012 RIMCAS Departure Monitor (RDM)
• 013 RIMCAS Runway / Taxiway Crossing Monitor (RCM)
• 014 RIMCAS Taxiway Separation Monitor (TSM)
• 015 RIMCAS Unauthorized Taxiway Movement Monitor(UTMM)
• 016 RIMCAS Stop Bar Overrun Alert (SBOA)
• 017 End Of Conflict (EOC)

dataitem.name: Data Source Identifier
dataitem.definition: Identification of the Safety Nets server sending the message.

field.name: SAC
field.desc: System Area Code fixed to zero

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

dataitem.name: SDPS Identifier
dataitem.definition: Identification of the SDPS providing data to the safety nets server.

field.name: SAC
field.desc: System Area Code fixed to zero

dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

dataitem.name: Time of Message
dataitem.definition: Absolute time stamping of the message in the form of elapsed time since last midnight
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
This time is given at an application level (e.g. time at which a message is filled), and not at the communication level (i.e. not the time at which the data- block containing the message is sent).

dataitem.name: Track Number 1
dataitem.definition: Identification of a track number related to conflict
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. This is the track number of the first track involved in the conflict in case of an STCA or a RIMCA or the track involved in case of one of the other Safety Net functions.
2.This track number is distributed in this field exactly as it was received from the Radar Processor Unit (identified by I004/015) and its range is depending on the range used by that unit

dataitem.name: Track Number 2
dataitem.definition: Together with I004/030, this item defines the track pair in conflict.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. This is the track number of the second track involved in the conflict in case of an STCA or a RIMCA.
2. For the other Safety Net functions, this item is not used.
3. This track number is distributed in this field exactly as it was received from the Radar Processor Unit and its range is depending on the range used by that unit

dataitem.name: Alert Identifier
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1.This item is the Alert Identification of the conflict in the system
2.This number shall be assigned, by the Safety Net Server, incrementally to every new alert and restart on zero after reaching the maximum value (65535)

dataitem.name: Alert Status
dataitem.definition: Information concerning status of the alert
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The content of this item is implementation dependent.

dataitem.name: Safety Net Function and System Status
dataitem.definition: Status of the Safety Nets functions handled by the system
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
1. This item only sent in “alive messages” to describe the status of the Safety Net functions, handled by the system
2. Value 0 means either that the function is not managed by the system or has failed.
3. Value 1 means that the function is managed by the system and is running well
4. “Overflow” is defined as a situation where the number of alerts in the system has exceeded the threshold for safe operation. Potential prioritization of the alerts may lead to a loss of information.
5. “Overload” is defined as a system status in which the number of alerts does not allow for a reliable performance. A correct calculation and transmission cannot be guaranteed.

dataitem.name: Conflict Timing and Separation
dataitem.definition: Information on Timing and Aircraft Separation

subfield.name: Time to Conflict
subfield.definition: Time remaining to actual conflict situation

subfield.name: Time to Closest Approach
subfield.definition: Time to closest proximity between entities in conflict

subfield.name: Current Horizontal Separation
subfield.definition: Current Horizontal Separation

subfield.name: Estimated Minimum Horizontal Separation
subfield.definition: Estimated minimum horizontal separation

subfield.name: Current Vertical Separation
subfield.definition: Current vertical separation

subfield.name: Estimated Minimum Vertical Separation
subfield.definition: Estimated minimum vertical separation

dataitem.name: Longitudinal Deviation
dataitem.definition: Longitudinal deviation for Route Adherence Monitoring, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
Longitudinal deviation will be positive if the aircraft is ahead of its planned position.
Longitudinal deviation will be negative if the aircraft is behind its planned position.

dataitem.name: Transversal Distance Deviation
dataitem.definition: Transversal distance deviation for Route Adherence Monitoring, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
Clockwise deviation will be coded as a positive value.
Anticlockwise deviation will be coded as a negative value

dataitem.name: Vertical Deviation
dataitem.definition: Vertical Deviation from planned altitude, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
Positive value if aircraft is above planned altitude
Negative value if aircraft is below planned altitude

dataitem.name: Area Definition
dataitem.definition: Definition of Areas involved in a Safety Net Alert

subfield.name: Area Name
subfield.definition: Name of the area involved in an APW alarm

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 Bits each) defining the name of the area. Coding rules are provided in [4] Section 3.1.2.9

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The area name is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space character.

subfield.name: Crossing Area Name
subfield.definition: Name of Crossing Area Involved in a RIMCA

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the name of the crossing area involved in a runway/taxiway crossing alert (message type 013)

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The name of the crossing area is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space characters.

subfield.name: Runway/Taxiway Designator 1
subfield.definition: Designator of Runway/Taxiway 1 Involved in a RIMCA

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the runway designator

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The runway designator is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space characters.
The runway is encoded as follows: Location indicator, runway direction, left or right.
Example: EGLL09L means London Heathrow (EGLL), Runway 09 (direction 090 degrees) left runway

subfield.name: Runway/Taxiway Designator 2
subfield.definition: Designator of Runway/Taxiway 2 Involved in a RIMCA

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the runway designator

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The runway designator is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space characters.
The runway is encoded as follows: Location indicator, runway direction, left or right.
Example: EGLL09L means London Heathrow (EGLL), Runway 09 (direction 090 degrees) left runway

subfield.name: Stop Bar Designator
subfield.definition: Designator of Stop-Bar Involved in a RIMCA

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the stop-bar involved in a stop-bar crossed alert (message type 016)

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The stop-bar designator is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space characters.

subfield.name: Gate Designator
subfield.definition: Gate Designator (in 7 characters) of the approaching aircraft in a RIMCA

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the gate for the approaching aircraft

subfield.desc:
NOTE
The gate designator is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space characters.

dataitem.name: FDPS Sector Control Identification
dataitem.definition: Identification of a list of FDPS Sector Control Positions in charge of the involved targets, as provided by the FDPS
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The Centre identification code and the Control position identification code must be defined between the communication partners.

subfield.name: Conflict Nature
subfield.definition: Nature of the conflict expressed by a set of properties Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of one octet.

field.name: MAS
field.enum: conflict not predicted to occur in military airspace
conflict predicted to occur in military airspace

field.name: CAS
field.enum: conflict not predicted to occur in civil airspace
conflict predicted to occur in civil airspace

field.name: FLD
field.enum: Aircraft are not fast diverging laterally at current time
Aircraft are fast diverging laterally at current time

field.name: FVD
field.enum: Aircraft are not fast diverging vertically at current time
Aircraft are fast diverging vertically at current time

field.name: Cross
field.enum: Aircraft have not crossed at starting time of conflict
Aircraft have crossed at starting time of conflict

field.name: Div
field.enum: Aircraft are not diverging at starting time of conflict
Aircraft are diverging at starting time of conflict

subfield.desc:
NOTES
The spare bits and extended octets may be used to define additional properties of a conflict.

subfield.name: Conflict Classification
subfield.definition: Severity classification of the conflict

field.name: Table Id
field.desc: Identification of conflict categories definition table

subfield.desc:
NOTES
Additional conflict classes may be defined by introducing additional properties of a conflict.

subfield.name: Conflict Probability
subfield.definition: Probality of the conflict

subfield.name: Conflict Duration
subfield.definition: The duration of the conflict is the elapsed time since the declaration of the conflict.

dataitem.name: Aircraft Identification and Characteristics 1
dataitem.definition: Identification and Characteristics of Aircraft 1 Involved in the Conflict.

subfield.name: Aircraft Identifier 1
subfield.definition: Aircraft Identifier (in 7 characters) of Aircraft 1 Involved in the Conflict

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the first aircraft

subfield.desc:
NOTES
The aircraft identifier is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space character.

subfield.name: Mode 3/A Code Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Mode-3/A code (converted into octal representation) of Aircraft 1 Involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Predicted Conflict Position Aircraft 1 (WGS-84)
subfield.definition: Predicted conflict position target 1 in WGS-84 Coordinates.

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^25 degrees

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ longitude < 180 deg. = 180/2^25 degrees

field.name: Altitude
field.desc: Altitude of predicted conflict (LSB)= 25ft, Hmin = -15FL, Hmax = 1500FL

subfield.name: Predicted Conflict Position Aircraft 1 in Cartesian Coordinates
subfield.definition: Predicted conflict position for the aircraft 1 involved in the conflict

field.name: X-position
field.desc: Starting X-position of the conflict LSB = 0.5m

field.name: Y-position
field.desc: Starting Y-position of the conflict LSB = 0.5m

field.name: Z-position
field.desc: Starting Z-position of the conflict LSB = 25ft

subfield.name: Time to Threshold Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Time to runway threshold for first approaching aircraft in a RIMCA

subfield.name: Distance to Threshold Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Distance from threshold for Aircraft 1 involved in a RIMCA.

subfield.name: Aircraft Characteristics Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Characteristics of Aircraft 1 involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Mode-S Identifier Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Aircraft Identification downloaded from Aircraft 1 involved in the Conflict if equipped with a Mode-S transponder.

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining aircraft identification when a flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available.Coding rules are provided in [4] Section 3.1.2.9

subfield.name: Flight Plan Number Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Number of the Flight Plan Correlated to Aircraft 1 Involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Cleared Flight Level Aircraft 1
subfield.definition: Cleared Flight Level for Aircraft 1 Involved in the Conflict

dataitem.name: Aircraft Identification and Characteristics 2
dataitem.definition: Identification and Characteristics of Aircraft 2 Involved in the Conflict.

subfield.name: Aircraft Identifier 2
subfield.definition: Aircraft Identifier (in 7 characters) of Aircraft 2 Involved in the Conflict

field.desc: Each octet is an ASCII character defining the first (SIC!) aircraft

subfield.desc:
NOTES
The aircraft identifier is always left adjusted. If needed, the remaining characters are filled with space character.

subfield.name: Mode 3/A Code Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Mode-3/A code (converted into octal representation) of Aircraft 2 Involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Predicted Conflict Position Aircraft 2 (WGS-84)
subfield.definition: Predicted conflict position target 2 in WGS-84 Coordinates.

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^25 degrees

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ longitude < 180 deg. = 180/2^25 degrees

field.name: Altitude
field.desc: Altitude of predicted conflict (LSB)= 25ft, Hmin = -15FL, Hmax = 1500FL

subfield.name: Predicted Conflict Position Aircraft 2 in Cartesian Coordinates
subfield.definition: Predicted conflict position for the aircraft 2 involved in the conflict

field.name: X-position
field.desc: Starting X-position of the conflict LSB = 0.5m

field.name: Y-position
field.desc: Starting Y-position of the conflict LSB = 0.5m

field.name: Z-position
field.desc: Starting Z-position of the conflict LSB = 25ft

subfield.name: Time to Threshold Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Time to runway threshold for first (SIC!) approaching aircraft in a RIMCA

subfield.name: Distance to Threshold Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Distance from threshold for Aircraft 2 involved in a RIMCA.

subfield.name: Aircraft Characteristics Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Characteristics of Aircraft 2 involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Mode-S Identifier Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Aircraft Identification downloaded from Aircraft 2 involved in the Conflict if equipped with a Mode-S transponder.

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining aircraft identification when a flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available.Coding rules are provided in [4] Section 3.1.2.9

subfield.name: Flight Plan Number Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Number of the Flight Plan Correlated to Aircraft 2 Involved in the Conflict

subfield.name: Cleared Flight Level Aircraft 2
subfield.definition: Cleared Flight Level for Aircraft 2 Involved in the Conflict
